senses.sense_definition: The basic, central, or essential point or feature of something.

examples.text: The <w>crux</w> of the matter is that we simply do not have enough money to continue.
She argued that the <w>crux</w> of the problem lay in poor communication between departments.

senses.sense_definition: The hardest point or most difficult section of a climb.

examples.text: The climber rested for a moment before attempting the <w>crux</w> of the route.
We managed to get past the <w>crux</w> without falling, although it was very slippery.

senses.sense_definition: A difficult problem or puzzle that is hard to explain or solve.

examples.text: The interpretation of this ancient poem remains a <w>crux</w> for many scholars.
Solving this chronological <w>crux</w> is essential for understanding the historical timeline.

senses.sense_definition: A distinctive winter constellation of the southern sky, shaped like a cross.

examples.text: Sailors in the southern hemisphere often used <w>Crux</w> to help navigate the seas.
On a clear night, you can easily spot <w>Crux</w> above the horizon.
